Index Sliding

Source: vignettes/index-sliding.Rmd
index-sliding.Rmd
library(slide)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(nycflights13)
library(lubridate)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'lubridate'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     date

weather_ewr <- weather %>%
  select(origin, time_hour, temp, dewp, humid, wind_speed) %>%
  filter(origin == "EWR") %>%
  mutate(time_hour = force_tz(time_hour, "UTC")) %>%
  slice(-2, -4, -5)

weather_gap <- slice(weather_ewr, 1:5)

weather_dups <- slice(weather_ewr, 10:15)
weather_dups$time_hour[5:6] <- weather_dups$time_hour[3:4]
weather_dups$time_hour[3:4] <- weather_dups$time_hour[2]

# notice that `weather_gap` is irregular because there are missing data points.
# otherwise, the index column is still increasing, and in this case there are
# no duplicates
weather_gap
#> # A tibble: 5 x 6
#>   origin time_hour            temp  dewp humid wind_speed
#>   <chr>  <dttm>              <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 EWR    2013-01-01 01:00:00  39.0  26.1  59.4       10.4
#> 2 EWR    2013-01-01 03:00:00  39.0  28.0  64.4       11.5
#> 3 EWR    2013-01-01 06:00:00  37.9  28.0  67.2       11.5
#> 4 EWR    2013-01-01 07:00:00  39.0  28.0  64.4       15.0
#> 5 EWR    2013-01-01 08:00:00  39.9  28.0  62.2       10.4

# you might watnt to compute the average temperature every 3 hours, using the
# current hour plus the 2 hours before

# with `slide_dbl()`, when `.before` is specified it looks backwards by the
# specified number of values. `slide()` and friends are not _index aware_

# mean(39.0)             | Hours: 1
# mean(39.0, 39.0)       | Hours: 1, 3
# mean(39.0, 39.0, 37.9) | Hours: 1, 3, 6
# mean(39.0, 37.9, 39.0) | Hours: 3, 6, 7
# mean(37.9, 39.0, 39.9) | Hours: 6, 7, 8
mutate(weather_gap, bad_roll_temp = slide_dbl(temp, mean, .before = 2))
#> # A tibble: 5 x 7
#>   origin time_hour            temp  dewp humid wind_speed bad_roll_temp
#>   <chr>  <dttm>              <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>         <dbl>
#> 1 EWR    2013-01-01 01:00:00  39.0  26.1  59.4       10.4          39.0
#> 2 EWR    2013-01-01 03:00:00  39.0  28.0  64.4       11.5          39.0
#> 3 EWR    2013-01-01 06:00:00  37.9  28.0  67.2       11.5          38.7
#> 4 EWR    2013-01-01 07:00:00  39.0  28.0  64.4       15.0          38.7
#> 5 EWR    2013-01-01 08:00:00  39.9  28.0  62.2       10.4          39.0

# mean(39.0)             | Hours: 1
# mean(39.0, 39.0)       | Hours: 1, 3
# mean(37.9)             | Hours: 6
# mean(37.9, 39.0)       | Hours: 6, 7
# mean(37.9, 39.0, 39.9) | Hours: 6, 7, 8
mutate(weather_gap, roll_temp = slide_index_dbl(temp, time_hour, mean, .before = hours(2)))
#> # A tibble: 5 x 7
#>   origin time_hour            temp  dewp humid wind_speed roll_temp
#>   <chr>  <dttm>              <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 EWR    2013-01-01 01:00:00  39.0  26.1  59.4       10.4      39.0
#> 2 EWR    2013-01-01 03:00:00  39.0  28.0  64.4       11.5      39.0
#> 3 EWR    2013-01-01 06:00:00  37.9  28.0  67.2       11.5      37.9
#> 4 EWR    2013-01-01 07:00:00  39.0  28.0  64.4       15.0      38.5
#> 5 EWR    2013-01-01 08:00:00  39.9  28.0  62.2       10.4      39.0
